content:
IContextAttribute Interface

Definition

Identifies a context attribute.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public interface IContextAttribute

Remarks

The IContextAttribute class is exposed from all context attributes. The attributes contribute a property that resides in a context and enforces a specific policy for the objects created in that context. For more information about using attributes, see Attributes.

Methods

GetPropertiesForNewContext(IConstructionCallMessage)

Returns context properties to the caller in the given message.

public void GetPropertiesForNewContext (System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.IConstructionCallMessage msg);
Parameters
msg
IConstructionCallMessage

The IConstructionCallMessage to which to add the context properties.

Remarks

The GetPropertiesForNewContext method can add context properties directly to the ContextProperties property list in the IConstructionCallMessage interface. The default implementation in the ContextAttribute class will add this to the context property list. Context attributes are free to override GetPropertiesForNewContext and can implement their own behavior. For example, they can add to the list a new class that implements the context property.

IsContextOK(Context, IConstructionCallMessage)

Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the specified context meets the context attribute's requirements.

public bool IsContextOK (System.Runtime.Remoting.Contexts.Context ctx, System.Runtime.Remoting.Activation.IConstructionCallMessage msg);
Parameters
ctx
Context

The context to check against the current context attribute.

msg
IConstructionCallMessage

The construction call, parameters of which need to be checked against the current context.

Returns
Boolean

true if the passed in context is okay; otherwise, false.
